properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 17 at 2:36AM AKST until January 18 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as
high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Kodiak Island.

* WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday morning.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Heavy snow and
blowing snow could produce white-out conditions at times.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow are expected to
develop by midnight Friday with the heaviest snow and
strongest winds occurring through mid-morning Saturday. It is
possible that enough warm air moves in by late morning to
change the snow to a mix of rain and snow by the end of the
event; however, there is still quite a bit of uncertainty
regarding this scenario.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING
